section.title: Built-in actions
section.para: You will find here the complete list of Jspresso built-in actions along with their Spring id and a short description.

row.entry: Pastes entities/components from the application clipboard.
Marks the selected objects for deletion (next save operation) and removes them from the master managed collection.
Gets a collection of entities to save out of the context and saves them transactionally.
Creates a filter model for QBE queries and set it as value of the filter model connector retrieved from the context.
Retrieves the current module filter connector and adds it in the context.
Executes an QBE query based on a filter retrieved from the context. The resulting entity collection is added to the context.
Reloads current module selected objects from the persistent store.
Marks current module selected objects for deletion (next save operation) and removes them from the module managed collection.
Saves the current module selected objects to the persistent store.
Generates a Jasper report and adds it to the context.
Executes a script taken out of the context. Supports any BSF supported language (Groovy, Jython, Beanshell, ...).
Executes a script statically defined as an action parameter. Supports any BSF supported language (Groovy, Jython, Beanshell, ...).
Opens a modal dialog box offering a choice of actions.
Takes an action out of the context and executes it.
Gets the selected action and places it in the context for execution.
Retrieves an object collection from the context and appends it to the master managed collection (no creation).
Moves downward the selected objects contained in an ordered collection.
After user confirmation, retrieves an object collection from the context and removes it from the master managed collection.
Moves upward the selected objects contained in an ordered collection.
Retrieves a binary property value out of the connector and opens a message box displaying the size of the binary content.
Let the user browse the local file system to choose a file. The file content is used as the content of a binary property.
Let the user browse the local file system to choose a file. The file is used to save the content of a binary property.
Computes and displays a fusioncharts chart.
Creates a new entity/component and adds it to the master managed collection. No icon nor accelerator set.
Creates a new entity/component and adds it to the master managed collection.
Opens a modal dialog to let the user choose an component/entity out of a collection retrieved from the context.
Duplicates selected entities/components and adds the clones to the master managed collection.
Copies the selected entities/components to the application clipboard.
Cuts the selected entities/components to the application clipboard.
Opens a dialog box to edit an entity/component in an arbitrary view.
Pastes entities/components from the application clipboard.
After user confirmation, marks the selected objects for deletion (next save operation) and removes them from the master managed collection.
Retrieves an arbitrary value from the context and assigns it to the view connector value.
Closes the top most dialog. Icon and name set.
Closes the top most dialog. Icon and name set.
Opens a modal dialog box that is parametrized out of context values (title, view bound to its model, size, secondary action list).
Let the user browse the local file system to choose a file. The selected file content is placed in the context.
Let the user browse the local file system to choose a file. The selected file is used to save an arbitrary content taken from the context.
Moves to the next result page of a filtered module.
Moves to the previous result page of a filtered module.
Performs the QBE query of a filtered module.
Retrieves an information message from the context and displays it to the user.
Translates an information message statically parametrized in the action and displays it to the user.
Performs the QBE query of a "list of values".
Moves to the next result page of a "list of values".
Gets the selected result from a "list of values" and places it in the context.
Moves to the previous result page of a "list of values".
Creates a new map and adds it to the master managed collection.
Duplicates selected maps and adds the clones to the master managed collection.
Duplicates selected maps and adds the clones to the master managed collection.
Duplicates selected entities/components and adds the clones to the module managed collection.
Reloads the module selected entity/component from the persistent store. entities/components previously marked for deletion are also restored.
After user confirmation, marks the selected module entities/components for deletion (next save operation) and removes them from the module managed collection.
Saves the module selected entities/components to the persistent store and performs deletion of previously "marked for deletion" entities/components.
Gets a module out or the context and selects it in the current workspace.
Gets selected module objects, adds them as current module children then selects them.
Retrieves an ok/cancel message out of the context and displays it to the user.
Retrieves an ok/cancel message statically parametrized in the action and displays it to the user.
Opens a dialog box allowing the user to initiate a password change operation (old, new, check).
Retrieves the selected Jasper report and puts it in the context for display/print.
Resets a property to its default value.
Displays/prints a Jasper report taken out of the context to the user.
Retrieves a Jasper report definition out of the context, opens the report parameters entry dialog, then triggers generation and display/print.
Opens a dialog box for the user to input a Jasper report parameters.
Triggers generation and display/print of a Jasper report after parameters input.
Gets a Jasper report definition statically defined as an action parameter, opens the report parameters entry dialog, then triggers generation and display/print.
Targets the browser (actually a new browser window/tab) to a URL retrieved from the context.

Targets the browser (actually a new browser window/tab) to a URL statically defined as an action parameter. The URL is previously translated so thant it can be variabilized based on the user language (used for online help for instance).
Retrieves an object collection out of the context and selects it on the collection view (table, list, tree).
Retrieves a yes/no binary question out of the context and displays it to the user.
Retrieves a yes/no binary question statically parametrized in the action and displays it to the user.
Retrieves a yes/no/cancel binary question out of the context and displays it to the user.
Retrieves a yes/no/cancel binary question statically parametrized in the action and displays it to the user.
